characters.title: Atticus Finch
characters.description: A lawyer in Maycomb. Father to Scout and Jem. Known for his integrity and sense of justice.

characters.title: Scout Finch
characters.description: The daughter of Atticus Finch. Known for her curiosity and innocence.

characters.title: Jem Finch
characters.description: The son of Atticus Finch and older brother to Scout. Mature and protective.

storypoints.title: Tom Robinson's Trial
storypoints.description: A pivotal moment in the story where Atticus defends Tom Robinson, a black man accused of raping a white woman, highlighting racial injustice.

storypoints.title: Boo Radley's Revelation
storypoints.description: The discovery that Boo Radley, a reclusive neighbor, has been secretly looking out for Scout and Jem, challenging their preconceived notions.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone

characters.title: Harry Potter
characters.description: The main protagonist, a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday.

characters.title: Hermione Granger
characters.description: Harry's intelligent and resourceful friend, known for her extensive knowledge of magic.

characters.title: Ron Weasley
characters.description: Harry's loyal and brave best friend, coming from a large family of wizards.

storypoints.title: The Philosopher's Stone
storypoints.description: Harry's quest to prevent Voldemort from obtaining the Philosopher's Stone, a powerful magical artifact.

storypoints.title: Quidditch Match
storypoints.description: Harry's first experience playing Quidditch, showcasing his talent and bravery.

characters.title: Jay Gatsby
characters.description: A mysterious millionaire known for his extravagant parties. Obsessed with Daisy Buchanan.

characters.title: Daisy Buchanan
characters.description: Gatsby's former lover, married to Tom Buchanan. Symbolizes wealth and the American Dream.

characters.title: Nick Carraway
characters.description: The narrator of the story, a young man from the Midwest who becomes involved with Gatsby's circle.

storypoints.title: Gatsby's Extravagant Parties
storypoints.description: Gatsby's lavish parties that serve as a backdrop for the story's themes of excess and superficiality.

storypoints.title: Myrtle's Death
storypoints.description: The tragic death of Myrtle Wilson, which sets off a chain of events leading to Gatsby's downfall.

characters.title: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.description: The protagonist, known for her intelligence and independence.

characters.title: Mr. Darcy
characters.description: A wealthy gentleman with a reputation for being proud and aloof.

characters.title: Jane Bennet
characters.description: Elizabeth's eldest sister, gentle and kind-hearted.

storypoints.title: Netherfield Ball
storypoints.description: A significant event where Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy's relationship begins to change.

storypoints.title: Lydia's Elopement
storypoints.description: The scandalous elopement of Elizabeth's sister, which threatens the family's reputation.

characters.title: Winston Smith
characters.description: The protagonist, a disillusioned citizen living under a totalitarian regime.

characters.title: Julia
characters.description: Winston's lover, who shares his disdain for the oppressive government.

characters.title: Big Brother
characters.description: The symbolic figurehead of the Party, representing absolute authority and surveillance.

storypoints.title: Thought Police
storypoints.description: The government's secret police force that monitors and punishes dissenting thoughts.

storypoints.title: Room 101
storypoints.description: A torture chamber where individuals are subjected to their worst fears, used for psychological manipulation.

characters.title: Holden Caulfield
characters.description: The disillusioned teenage protagonist, struggling with the phoniness of the adult world.

characters.title: Phoebe Caulfield
characters.description: Holden's younger sister, whom he adores for her innocence.

characters.title: Mr. Antolini
characters.description: Holden's former teacher, who offers him guidance and support.

storypoints.title: Pencey Prep
storypoints.description: The boarding school from which Holden is expelled, reflecting his feelings of alienation and disconnection.

storypoints.title: Holden's Red Hunting Cap
storypoints.description: A symbolic item representing Holden's desire to protect innocence and individuality.

characters.title: Bilbo Baggins
characters.description: The protagonist, a hobbit who embarks on an unexpected adventure.

characters.title: Gandalf
characters.description: A wise wizard who recruits Bilbo for the quest to reclaim Erebor.

characters.title: Thorin Oakenshield
characters.description: The leader of the dwarves seeking to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

storypoints.title: Riddles in the Dark
storypoints.description: Bilbo's encounter with Gollum, where he acquires the One Ring.

storypoints.title: The Battle of Five Armies
storypoints.description: A climactic battle involving humans, elves, dwarves, orcs, and eagles.

characters.title: Ishmael
characters.description: The narrator of the story, a sailor aboard the whaling ship Pequod.

characters.title: Captain Ahab
characters.description: The obsessed captain of the Pequod, seeking revenge on the white whale Moby Dick.

characters.title: Queequeg
characters.description: A skilled harpooner and Ishmael's close friend.

storypoints.title: Ahab's Quest
storypoints.description: Captain Ahab's monomaniacal pursuit of Moby Dick, symbolizing obsession and revenge.

storypoints.title: The Final Chase
storypoints.description: The climactic and tragic encounter between the Pequod and Moby Dick.

characters.title: Victor Frankenstein
characters.description: The scientist who creates the Creature, driven by ambition and curiosity.

characters.title: The Creature
characters.description: Frankenstein's creation, seeking acceptance and revenge for his suffering.

characters.title: Elizabeth Lavenza
characters.description: Victor's fianc√©e, embodying beauty and virtue.

storypoints.title: The Creation
storypoints.description: Victor's successful but disastrous experiment to create life.

storypoints.title: The Creature's Revenge
storypoints.description: The Creature's acts of vengeance against Victor, culminating in tragedy.

characters.title: Odysseus
characters.description: The hero of the epic, known for his cunning and resourcefulness.

characters.title: Penelope
characters.description: Odysseus's faithful wife, waiting for his return to Ithaca.

characters.title: Telemachus
characters.description: Odysseus's son, who grows into manhood during his father's absence.

storypoints.title: The Trojan War
storypoints.description: The war from which Odysseus is returning, marking the beginning of his long journey.

storypoints.title: The Cyclops
storypoints.description: Odysseus's encounter with Polyphemus, showcasing his cleverness.
